class_notes: This course is designed to introduce biologists and computer scientists to basic bioinformatics principles, concepts, and techniques.  By the end of this course, students will possess a bioinformatics skill set, including an informed vocabulary, sufficient for a productive collaboration within a multi-disciplinary research team.  This course is aimed at third- and fourth-year students who have taken a few of the introductory Biology, Biochemistry, or Genetics courses and have basic proficiency in Python.  Permission of instructor is required.  Contact Professor Bromberg at ybrombe@emory.edu for permission.  Prerequisites:  Biology 142, 142L, and 264.  This course will also be taught as CS 485 and CS 584 but is NOT cross-listed.
course_description: A course on topics of special biological interest, designed for Biology majors elective credit. This course is repeatable when the topic varies.
prerequisites: (BIOL 142 and BIOL 142L) or BIOL_OX 142WE or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
